article.headline: Toledo 74, N. Illinois 69
article.story: TOLEDO, Ohio -- Jonathan Amos scored 19 points and Tyrone Kent's dunk and two free throws in the final seconds secured Toledo's 74-69 win over Northern Illinois on Sunday afternoon. Toledo (7-24, 5-11 Mid-American) maintained a single-digit lead throughout the second half, and went up 72-66 when Kent hit his only two free throws of the game with 12 seconds remaining. Michael Patton got Northern Illinois (10-19, 5-11) to within three with eight seconds left with his fifth 3-pointer, but Kent's dunk ended any threat of the Huskies sending it into overtime. Kent and Justin Anyijong both finished with 15 points and Mohamed Lo added 10 points for the Rockets. Amos and Kent played in their final regular season game for Toledo. Patton and Michael Fakuade both scored 15 points, Darion Anderson had 13 and Najul Ervin added 12 points, as well as 11 rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
